results.title: Alice through the lift door: the other side of shopping
results.brief_description: A brief history of the various types of stores in Australia from the early market days to the present day large department store and shopping centre complexes. The behind the scenes operations of a department store are described.

results.title: Alice Springs: red heart blue centre
results.creator_credit: James Coffey, Frank Bagnall, Department of the Northern Territory and Film Australia
results.brief_description: Alice Springs is viewed here in its natural environment of desert landscape, ringed by distant ranges and Ayers Rock and as a busy township with its regular services, activities and recreations. From varied shots of its people and activities the camera frequently returns to the countryside around and shows close-up shots of its plant life. No spoken commentary.
results.creator_credit_for_label: James Coffey, Frank Bagnall, Department of the Northern Territory and Film Australia

results.title: Alice Moyle
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Australia Council archival film series: on music”.
Alice Moyle was born in South Africa on 25th December 1908 and spent her first four years there before migrating out to Australia with her parents. She learned the piano and studied music at school, attending the University of Melbourne Conservatorium where she graduated with a Bachelor of Music in 1930. Alice Moyle’s first experience of Aboriginal music was listening to recordings made by Professor Elkin when she was attending courses at the Faculty of Music at Sydney University. These recordings were to prepare teachers for work in the outback. In 1959 Alice made the first of many field trips into the outback to continue the process of recording and archiving Aboriginal music. She has continually tried to inspire others with her experiences and knowledge in Aboriginal music and culture and is adamant that music be included as an essential component in the study of Aboriginal culture. This documentary is a recorded interview between Alice Moyle and James Murdoch.

results.title: Alice in wonderland [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Wilfred Jackson, Hamilton Luske, Clyde Geronimi, Walt Disney and Walt Disney Animation Studios
results.brief_description: Animated version of Lewis Carroll’s famous story about the delightful Alice who goes on a dream fantasy adventure where animals are like humans and everything is nonsense. Voices provided by Kathryn Beaumont, Ed Wynn, Richard Haydn and Stirling Holloway.

results.title: Alice in Wonderland
results.creator_credit: Edward H. Sloman, John W. Considine and Gordon W. Hedwig
results.brief_description: This film opens on a theatre full of people. The conductor steps up and the curtains open - music starts. Irving Berlin music introduces characters from Lewis Carrolls’ “Alice in Wonderland”. As the song plays, Alice encounters each character, each elaborately costumed. Once all the characters have been introduced, the song ends; the curtain closes; the audinece applauds. Devised as a film, this piece plays like a number from a vaudeville show.

results.title: Alice in Wonderland
results.brief_description: On a golden afternoon, young Alice follows a White Rabbit, who disappears down a nearby rabbit hole. Quickly following him, she tumbles into the burrow - and enters the merry, topsy-turvy world of Wonderland! Memorable songs and whimsical escapades highlight Alice’s journey, which culminates in a madcap encounter with the Queen of Hearts - and her army of playing cards!

constellations_other.name: MoCaps and rotos
constellations_other.description: Though VFX continues to push boundaries and brings fantastical worlds and creatures to life, there's still a place for classic animation techniques.

results.title: Alice in wonderland
results.creator_credit: Nick Willing, Dyson Lovell, Babelsberg International Film Produktion and Hallmark Entertainment
results.brief_description: After running away from home, Alice steps into a rabbit hole and enters an incredible magical world full of adventure. Originally produced for television, this adaptation of the Lewis Carroll classic features an impressive cast and special effects from Frame Store and Jim Henson’s Creature Shop. Cast includes Robbie Coltrane, Whoopi Goldberg, Ben Kingsley, Christopher Lloyd, Martin Short and many more.

results.title: Alice in the cities = Alice in den Stadten
results.creator_credit: Wim Wenders, Joachim von Mengershausen and Filmverlag der Autoren
results.brief_description: Through the story of a disillusioned young photojournalist who, returning from a fruitless assignment in the States, unwittingly becomes involved in a little girl’s search for her family in the North German industrial heartland, Wenders forges a distinctly European variation on the road movie. Few films capture so evocatively the feeling of life in the 20th century technological jungle, but for all its vistas of alienation and Americanisation, “Alice in the cities” finally resolves itself into a touching, indeed moving, affirmation of human relationships in an otherwise bleak world. Cast includes Rudiger Vogler and Yella Rottlander, with a haunting musical score by Can.

results.title: Alice in blunderland
results.creator_credit: W M. Moloney and Road Safety Council of New South Wales
results.brief_description: Road safety film made in Sydney using a parallel with the Alice in Wonderland fairytale to discuss issues of pedestrian and driver safety. Focusses on Alice who is more intent on her shopping than on paying attention to the traffic. She meets up with her boyfriend, “The Mad Hatter” and they go for a drive in the country and demonstrate the dangers of admiring the scenery instead of the road. Gives statistics comparing road deaths in NSW with WWII casualties. Features flashback footage of Sydney in 1908.
